articles.title: Facing a mental health crisis, an NJ school pulled a beloved novel from English class - NPR
articles.description: Junot Díaz's The Brief Wondrous Life of Oscar Wao was removed from an English class at the public school. PEN America says it's part of a trend of scrubbing literature dealing with uncomfortable topics.
articles.content:
Editor's note: This report is about suicide and suicidal ideation.
The South Orange & Maplewood community in New Jersey has been through some very tough times. Schools superintendent Jason Bing … [+12020 chars]
